Academic Website

Academic Website

Overview

This is a Jekyll-based static website designed for academic professionals to showcase their research, projects, and professional activities. The site provides a clean, professional presentation with sections for research publications, current projects, blog posts, and miscellaneous professional activities. Built with Jekyll and designed to be hosted on platforms like GitHub Pages, it offers an easy-to-maintain solution for academics to establish their online presence.

User Preferences

Preferred communication style: Simple, everyday language.

System Architecture

Frontend Architecture

  • Static Site Generator: Jekyll with Liquid templating engine
  • Theme: Custom Minima-based theme for clean academic presentation
  • Layout Structure: Modular layout system with default, page, and post templates
  • Navigation: Custom navigation component with responsive mobile menu
  • Content Organization: Markdown-based content with YAML front matter for metadata

Content Management

  • Blog System: Jekyll posts with date-based organization and RSS feed generation
  • Page Structure: Separate pages for research, projects, blog, and miscellaneous content
  • Media Handling: Placeholder system for photos and external media references
  • SEO Optimization: Built-in Jekyll SEO plugin integration

Template System

  • Component Architecture: Reusable includes for header, footer, navigation, and social links
  • Layout Inheritance: Hierarchical layout system (default â†’ page/post)
  • Content Sections: Structured sections for publications, projects, teaching, and personal interests
  • Responsive Design: Mobile-first approach with collapsible navigation

Styling and Presentation

  • CSS Framework: Custom stylesheet extending Minima theme
  • Social Integration: Built-in social media link components for GitHub, Twitter, LinkedIn
  • Feed Generation: Automatic RSS feed creation for blog posts
  • Typography: Academic-focused typography with proper heading hierarchy

External Dependencies

Core Dependencies

  • Jekyll: Static site generator and templating engine
  • Jekyll SEO Tag: Search engine optimization plugin
  • Jekyll Feed: RSS feed generation plugin
  • Minima Theme: Base theme providing styling and structure

Hosting and Deployment

  • GitHub Pages: Recommended hosting platform (implied by Jekyll structure)
  • RSS Feed: Built-in feed.xml generation for blog subscriptions

Social Media Integration

  • GitHub: Profile linking and repository showcasing
  • Twitter: Social media presence integration
  • LinkedIn: Professional networking integration

Content Delivery

  • Placeholder Services: via.placeholder.com for image placeholders
  • SVG Icons: Minima social icons for consistent branding
  • Google Analytics: Optional analytics integration for production environments
